timeline.title: Application Opens
timeline.description: The University of California Application opens for the academic term beginning next Fall.
timeline.searchable_text: August 1 Application Opens The University of California Application opens for the academic term beginning next Fall.

timeline.title: Submit Your Fall 2025 Application
timeline.description: Submit the University of California Application by the December 2 deadline.
timeline.searchable_text: October 1 - December 2 Submit Your Fall 2025 Application Submit the University of California Application by the December 2 deadline.

timeline.title: FAFSA and California Dream Act Open
timeline.description: FAFSA and California Dream Act applications open. Only complete one.
bullet_points: U.S. citizens and permanent residents: Complete FAFSA, use IRS data retrieval for tax information.

Non-U.S. citizens: Complete California Dream Act Application if you are a California resident not eligible for FAFSA who attended a CA High School for 3 years or more and will or have already graduated (AB540 eligible).
timeline.searchable_text: October FAFSA and California Dream Act Open FAFSA and California Dream Act applications open. Only complete one. U.S. citizens and permanent residents: Complete FAFSA, use IRS data retrieval for tax information. Non-U.S. citizens: Complete California Dream Act Application if you are a California resident not eligible for FAFSA who attended a CA High School for 3 years or more and will or have already graduated (AB540 eligible).

timeline.title: Applicant Portal
timeline.description: Upon receipt of their application, applicants will receive an email invitation to the Applicant Portal with login instructions. Make sure you check all email folders to ensure you are receiving emails from us and they are not being marked as spam.
timeline.searchable_text: December Applicant Portal Upon receipt of their application, applicants will receive an email invitation to the Applicant Portal with login instructions. Make sure you check all email folders to ensure you are receiving emails from us and they are not being marked as spam.

timeline.title: Complete Your Transfer Academic Update
timeline.description: You must log in to your application and complete the Transfer Academic Update.
timeline.searchable_text: January 31 Complete Your Transfer Academic Update You must log in to your application and complete the Transfer Academic Update.

timeline.title: File Your FAFSA or California Dream Act Application
timeline.description: File your FAFSA or California Dream Act application. Forms are also available from your school counselor. Applications are reviewed on a first-come, first-served basis. See Financial Aid timeline for more details.
bullet_points: List UC San Diego school code 001317 on your application.
Meet the April 2 deadline to be considered for the best possible funding.
timeline.searchable_text: April 2 File Your FAFSA or California Dream Act Application File your FAFSA or California Dream Act application. Forms are also available from your school counselor. Applications are reviewed on a first-come, first-served basis. See Financial Aid timeline for more details. List UC San Diego school code 001317 on your application. Meet the April 2 deadline to be considered for the best possible funding. Apply for a Cal Grant.

timeline.title: Transfer Admission Decisions Posted
timeline.description: Transfer admission decisions will be posted on the Applicant Portal.
timeline.searchable_text: By April 30 Transfer Admission Decisions Posted Transfer admission decisions will be posted on the Applicant Portal.

timeline.title: Appeals for Applicants Not Admitted
timeline.description: Every application to UC San Diego is reviewed thoroughly. Admission decisions are made carefully to meet the enrollment goals of the university. Therefore, successful appeals are very rare. Applicants who have new and compelling academic information that was not presented in their original application, may submit an appeal through their Applicant Portal by May 9 No appeals will be accepted after the deadline.

links.text: submit an appeal through their Applicant Portal

timeline.searchable_text: May 9 Appeals for Applicants Not Admitted Every application to UC San Diego is reviewed thoroughly. Admission decisions are made carefully to meet the enrollment goals of the university. Therefore, successful appeals are very rare. Applicants who have new and compelling academic information that was not presented in their original application, may submit an appeal through their Applicant Portal by May 9 No appeals will be accepted after the deadline.

timeline.title: Applicants invited to join the Waitlist
timeline.description: Select applicants will be invited to opt in to our waitlist through their Applicant Portal. Transfer applicants must opt in to the waitlist by 11:59 p.m. (PT) on May 15. Being on the waitlist does not guarantee an offer of admission. We strongly urge students to accept another university's admission offer before the appropriate deadline to ensure they have secured a spot at an institution. By July 31, final decisions will be released to applicants who opt in to the waitlist.
timeline.searchable_text: May 15 Applicants invited to join the Waitlist Select applicants will be invited to opt in to our waitlist through their Applicant Portal. Transfer applicants must opt in to the waitlist by 11:59 p.m. (PT) on May 15. Being on the waitlist does not guarantee an offer of admission. We strongly urge students to accept another university's admission offer before the appropriate deadline to ensure they have secured a spot at an institution. By July 31, final decisions will be released to applicants who opt in to the waitlist.

timeline.title: Deadline to Accept UC San Diego's Offer of Admission
timeline.description: Accept your offer through the Applicant Portal.
timeline.searchable_text: June 1 Deadline to Accept UC San Diego's Offer of Admission Accept your offer through the Applicant Portal.

timeline.title: Deadline to Submit Your Final Transcripts
bullet_points: Submit all official college and/or university transcripts. You do not need to submit a high school transcript if you satisfied the American History & Institution requirement with college-level coursework or by earning a 3 or higher on the AP U.S. History exam. If you attended high school outside of the U.S., an official transcript is not required.
Refer to Required Documents from Schools Outside the United States if any of your coursework was taken outside the U.S.

links.text: Required Documents from Schools Outside the United States
links.markdown: [Required Documents from Schools Outside the United States](/first-year/required-documents.html)

timeline.searchable_text: July 1 Deadline to Submit Your Final Transcripts Submit all official college and/or university transcripts. You do not need to submit a high school transcript if you satisfied the American History & Institution requirement with college-level coursework or by earning a 3 or higher on the AP U.S. History exam. If you attended high school outside of the U.S., an official transcript is not required. Refer to Required Documents from Schools Outside the United States if any of your coursework was taken outside the U.S.

timeline.title: AP and IB Exam Results Due
timeline.description: AP and IB exam results are due no later than July 15.
bullet_points: Please request results be sent to UC San Diego, school code: 004836.
For more information, please refer to the Advanced Placement FAQs.
timeline.searchable_text: July 15 AP and IB Exam Results Due AP and IB exam results are due no later than July 15. Please request results be sent to UC San Diego, school code: 004836. For more information, please refer to the Advanced Placement FAQs.
